Class NetworkSearch

java.lang.Object
NetworkSearch
public class NetworkSearch extends Object
Utility class that represents an ongoing network search

  • Constructor Details

    • NetworkSearch

      public NetworkSearch(String ID, int requestAmount, HashMap<String,Integer> manifest)
      Primary constructor for a network search
      Parameters:
      ID - assigned ID for this search
      requestAmount - amount of requests that will be sent by this search
      manifest - resources that this search is looking for

  • Method Details

    • getByID

      public static NetworkSearch getByID(String searchID)
      Returns a search conducted from the thread this method is called from, found in all searches ever conducted
      Parameters:
      searchID - the search's identifier
      Returns:
      the search object if found, null otherwise

    • isFirstSearch

      public boolean isFirstSearch()
      The algorithm conducts searches in a two-staged manner (if sent directly by a request originator)
      Returns:
      current status of this search

    • makeSecond

      public void makeSecond()
      Marks this search as being on its second stage

    • makeFirst

      public void makeFirst()
      Marks this search as being on its first stage

    • getID

      public String getID()
      Returns:
      node-wide search identifier (clientName:sequentialNumber)

    • getAmountLeft

      public int getAmountLeft()
      Returns:
      amount of searches left to perform for this operation to complete

    • setAmountLeft

      public void setAmountLeft(int newAmount)
      Changes the amount of requests left in this search
      Parameters:
      newAmount - the amount of requests still left to be performed

    • incAmountLeft

      public void incAmountLeft(int offset)
      Offsets this searches amount of searches left by a given amount
      Parameters:
      offset - amount to offset by

    • getResourceLeft

      public int getResourceLeft(String resName)
      Parameters:
      resName - the name of the resource
      Returns:
      amount that is still to be locked

    • getResourceTotal

      public int getResourceTotal(String resName)
      Parameters:
      resName - the name of the resource
      Returns:
      amount of this resource in search manifest

    • getManifest

      public HashMap<String,Integer> getManifest()
      Returns:
      entire manifest key: resource name value: amount

    • getRemaining

      public HashMap<String,Integer> getRemaining()
      Returns:
      remaining parts of manifest key: resource name value: amount

    • isFailedHost

      public boolean isFailedHost(String address)
      Checks if a provided address has any of the resources this search is looking for
      Parameters:
      address - string address formatted as ip:port
      Returns:
      true if there are no resources this search needs on that host

    • addFailedHost

      public void addFailedHost(String address)
      Marks a host as failed, that it has none of the resources this search is looking for.
      Parameters:
      address - address:port string of the failed host
